snippet: In one of the few credible terrorist plots to go to court, two men who admitted to planning attacks in 2009 are expected to testify in a suspected co-conspirator’s trial, which starts Monday.
abstract: Queens residents Zarein Ahmedzay and Najibullah Zazi plead guilty to planning three separate bomb attacks on the New York City subway system in 2009; third man, Adis Medunjanin, will go to trial in connection with plot described as one of the most serious terrorist threats to the United States since Sept 11; rarely has such a homegrown terrorism plot gone to trial, and event will be closely watched for insight into how the fight against terrorism is being prosecuted.
lead_paragraph: In one of the few credible terrorist plots to go to court, two men who admitted to planning attacks in 2009 are expected to testify in a suspected co-conspirator’s trial, which starts Monday.

headline.seo: Revelations Expected in Trial of Adis Medunjanin, a Terror Suspect
headline.main: Homegrown Bomb Plot Is Rarity for Open Court
headline.print_headline: Homegrown Bomb Plot Is Rarity for Open Court
